XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 99.
_description: John Lydgate, ‘A Gentlewoman’s Lament’ — seven 8-line stanzas

CamTCC600.First Lines:
Allas I wooful creatureLyving betweene hope and dreedHowe
                    might I þe woo endureIn tendrenesse of wommanhede…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…To haue hooly my RemembraunceOn his persone so mychil I
                    thynke
CamTCC600.Attributed Title:
And here begynneþe a balade sayde by a gentil womman whiche loued a
                    man of gret estate (p. 152); A Womans Compleynte made by Lidegate (RT,
                    152-154)
CamTCC600.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 418-20.

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
Allas I wofull creaturelyuinge betwene hope and dredhow mighte
                    I the woo endurein tendernesse of womanhede…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…to haue holy my remembraunceon hys persone so mychill I
                    thynke
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title:
And here begynneth a balade sayde by a gentillwoman which loued a man of
                    gret estate made by lidgate (f. 160)

BLHar2251.First Lines:
Allas woful creatureLyveng betwene hope and
                    drede…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…Is whether that I wake of wynkeTo have holy my
                    RemembraunceOn his persone so mochil I thynk
BLHar2251.Editions:
Halliwell-Phillipps,  James Orchard,
                        ed.  
             A Selection from the Minor Poems of Don John Lydgate.
Percy Society
         2. London: T. Richard, 1840: 220-2.
